title: By the King. A proclamation for the suppressing of disorderly and unseasonable meetings, in taverns and tipling-houses, and also forbidding footmen to wear swords, or other weapons, within London, Westminster, and their liberties
author: England and Wales. Sovereign (1660-1685 : Charles II)
publisher: Printed by John Bill and Christopher Barker, Printers to the Kings most Excellent Majesty,
notes: Dated at end: Given at Our Court at Whitehall the twenty ninth day of September, in the twelfth year of Our Reign.
Reproduction of the original in the British Library.
